intro: Columnea ambigua, commonly known as the zigzag plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and vibrant, tubular flowers. The plant produces showy, often red or orange flowers that attract hummingbirds and other pollinators. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a slightly zigzagged appearance, giving it its common name. Columnea ambigua is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its ornamental value and adaptability to indoor environments.
